articles.author: Carolyn Y. Johnson
articles.title: Ancient DNA suggests syphilis originated in Americas before ravaging Europe - The Washington Post
articles.description: For centuries, scientists have disputed the origins of syphilis. A new study of ancient DNA supports an American origin for syphilis, before Columbus arrived.
articles.content: In 1495, a devastating infection began to sweep across Europe, causing pustules and sores to erupt on peoples bodies and faces. Accusatory finger-pointing about the scourge, syphilis, began almost im… [+140 chars]
